unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Tightened at Tata Steel Following Recent Scrutiny**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Tightened at Tata Steel Following Recent Scrutiny

unnormalised: Jamshedpur, Jharkhand - Tata Steel has announced a significant overhaul of its quality control processes across its manufacturing facilities, following increased scrutiny after a minor product defect was reported last month. The company aims to enhance its defect detection rate by 25% by Q4 2024.
normalised: Jamshedpur, Jharkhand - Tata Steel has announced a significant overhaul of its quality control processes across its manufacturing facilities, following increased scrutiny after a minor product defect was reported last month. The company aims to enhance its defect detection rate by twenty five percent by Q four two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Dr. Anjali Sharma, Head of Quality Assurance, stated that the revamp includes implementing stricter adherence to ISO 9001 standards and investing in advanced testing equipment, including X-ray diffraction units. New inspection stations, encompassing an additional 5,000 sq ft, are being built at the Jamshedpur plant.
